# Fulfilment & Operations Playbook — Intus Ecommerce Supplement
**Supplements:** No original deliverable (new coverage area)
**Department:** Distribution & Growth Engine
**Intelligence Source:** Ecommerce Operations Notebook (2025 benchmarks)
**Date:** February 2026

---

## Why This Supplement Exists

The Intus Launch Kit covers brand strategy, creative, digital architecture, and distribution. But it contains zero coverage of fulfilment, shipping, returns, or inventory management. For a DTC Intentional Movement brand with physical products shipping to Australia and the USA, operations strategy directly impacts margin, customer experience, and scalability. This playbook fills that gap — especially critical given the August 2025 US de minimis duty repeal that changes international shipping economics.

---

## 1. Fulfilment Architecture: Current State & Roadmap

### 1.1 Phase Model

| Phase | Order Volume | Fulfilment Model | When |
|-------|-------------|-----------------|------|
| **Phase 1: Startup** | 0-100 orders/month | Self-fulfil or micro-3PL | Now |
| **Phase 2: Growth** | 100-500 orders/month | Australian 3PL | Month 3-6 |
| **Phase 3: Scale** | 500+ orders/month (200+ to US) | AU 3PL + US 3PL hub | Month 6-12 |

### 1.2 When to Move from Self-Fulfil to 3PL

Switch when ANY of these are true:
- Spending >15 hours/week on packing and shipping
- Order accuracy dropping below 99%
- Missing same-day dispatch cutoffs regularly
- Unable to process returns within 48 hours
- Growth is being limited by operational capacity

---

## 2. 3PL Selection (Phase 2)

### 2.1 Selection Criteria for 100-500 Orders/Month

At this volume, you're in a "dead zone" — too big for a garage, too small for leverage with major 3PLs. Prioritize technology integration and scalability over raw price per pick.

| Criteria | Minimum Standard | Why It Matters |
|----------|-----------------|---------------|
| **Pick/pack accuracy** | 99.5%+ | Errors cost $10-15 per incident (re-ship + return processing). At 1% error rate on 300 orders = 3 errors/month = $30-45 wasted. |
| **Same-day dispatch SLA** | Orders before 2pm AEST dispatched same day | Consumer expectation in 2025: ~3.1 days click-to-door. Same-day dispatch is the only way to hit this. |
| **Shopify integration** | Native/real-time sync | Real-time inventory visibility prevents overselling. Non-negotiable. |
| **Returns processing** | Accept and process returns within 48 hours | 60-day guarantee means returns will happen. Fast processing = fast restocking. |
| **Scalability** | Can handle 3x current volume without renegotiation | Black Friday, launch spikes, viral moments. Don't get locked into a capacity ceiling. |
| **Reporting** | Real-time dashboard (orders, inventory, returns) | You need visibility to make decisions. Monthly reports aren't enough. |

### 2.2 Australian 3PL Options to Evaluate

| Provider Type | Pros | Cons | Best For |
|--------------|------|------|----------|
| **Melbourne-based micro-3PL** | Local to Intus HQ, easy oversight, flexible | Limited tech, may not scale | Phase 2 (100-300 orders) |
| **National 3PL** (e.g., ShipBob AU, Sendle Fulfilment) | Tech-forward, Shopify native, multi-warehouse | Higher minimums, less personal | Phase 2-3 (300+ orders) |
| **Shopify Fulfillment Network** | Native integration, designed for Shopify brands | Availability/coverage varies | Evaluate when available in AU |

### 2.3 Key Contract Terms to Negotiate

| Term | What to Push For |
|------|-----------------|
| **No minimum order commitment** | Early-stage volume fluctuates. Don't lock in 500/month minimums. |
| **Transparent pricing** | Per-pick, per-pack, per-ship clearly broken out. No "handling fees" that balloon. |
| **Exit clause** | 30-day exit notice maximum. You need flexibility to switch. |
| **Peak surcharge cap** | Black Friday/Christmas surcharges capped at 20% above standard rates. |
| **Returns processing included** | Some 3PLs charge extra per return. Negotiate this into the base rate. |

---

## 3. Shipping Strategy

### 3.1 Domestic (Australia)

| Tier | Delivery Time | Cost to Customer | Cost to Intus (est.) | When to Offer |
|------|-------------|-----------------|---------------------|---------------|
| **Standard** | 3-5 business days | FREE over $150 AUD / $9.95 under | $8-12 per order | Default option |
| **Express** | 1-2 business days | $14.95 AUD | $12-18 per order | Optional upgrade |

**Free shipping threshold:** $150 AUD (already set in Deliverable 10). This is correctly positioned just above the Kit AOV ($100) to incentivize Kit + accessory purchases.

**Shipping cost as % of AOV:**

| Scenario | Shipping Cost | AOV | % of AOV | Status |
|----------|-------------|-----|----------|--------|
| Kit purchase ($100) below threshold | $8-12 (Intus pays) if free / customer pays $9.95 | $100 | 8-12% | Acceptable |
| Kit + accessory ($150+) free shipping | $8-12 (Intus absorbs) | $150+ | 5-8% | Good — within 10% target |
| Express upgrade | Customer pays $14.95 | $100+ | 0% to Intus | Profit-positive |

**Target:** Keep total logistics costs (fulfilment + shipping) below 20-25% of AOV. Monitor this monthly.

### 3.2 International (Australia → United States)

**CRITICAL: US De Minimis Duty Repeal (August 2025)**

As of August 29, 2025, the US has suspended the de minimis duty-free treatment for shipments under $800. This fundamentally changes Intus's US shipping economics:

| Before Aug 2025 | After Aug 2025 |
|-----------------|---------------|
| Ship a $100 Kit from Melbourne → LA **duty-free** | Same package now subject to **duties + formal customs entry** |
| Simple, fast customs clearance | Potential customs delays + brokerage fees |
| No surprise costs for US customer | Customer may face unexpected duties at delivery |

### 3.3 US Shipping Strategy (Revised)

**Phase 1: Direct Ship from AU (Now — while US volume is <200 orders/month)**

| Element | Setup |
|---------|-------|
| **Shipping method** | DHL Express or Australia Post International from Melbourne |
| **Delivery time** | 5-10 business days |
| **Duties handling** | DDP (Delivered Duty Paid) — Intus pays duties upfront so customer has no surprise costs |
| **Cost to Intus** | $25-40 AUD per order (shipping + duties + brokerage) |
| **Customer price** | $19.95 USD flat rate (absorb remaining cost as marketing expense) |

**Why DDP:** "Surprise" duties at delivery = instant customer rage + high return rate. Always prepay duties for US customers. Build the cost into your US pricing or absorb it as customer acquisition cost.

**Phase 2: US Fulfilment Hub (When US volume exceeds 200 orders/month)**

| Element | Setup |
|---------|-------|
| **Strategy** | Bulk import inventory by freight (sea or air) to a US 3PL warehouse |
| **Benefits** | Domestic US shipping (2-5 days), no per-package duties, lower shipping cost ($5-8 per order) |
| **Trigger** | 200+ consistent US orders/month for 2+ consecutive months |
| **3PL options** | ShipBob US, Deliverr, or any Shopify-integrated US 3PL |
| **Inventory risk** | Must commit to US-based inventory. Start with top-selling SKUs only (Reformer Kit, Street Kit). |

**Timeline decision point:** Review US volume monthly. When US orders hit 150+/month with upward trend, start 3PL onboarding (takes 4-6 weeks to set up).

---

## 4. Returns Management

### 4.1 Return Rate Benchmarks

| Metric | Industry Average | Intus Target | Strategy to Achieve |
|--------|-----------------|-------------|-------------------|
| **Overall return rate** | 16.9% (retail avg), 20-30% (apparel DTC) | <18% | Fit tools, UGC, detailed size guides |
| **Size-related returns** | 50-60% of all apparel returns | <40% (with fit tools) | Fit predictor reduces by 12-18% (S01 CRO Playbook) |
| **Return processing cost** | $10-15 per return | Minimize through self-service | Automated return portal reduces support time |

### 4.2 Return Processing Flow

```
Customer initiates return
    ↓
Self-service portal (Loop Returns or Shopify native)
    ↓
Reason selection (Size too small / Size too big / Didn't like fit / Quality / Other)
    ↓
Return label generated → Customer ships
    ↓
[DATA: Feed reason codes back to product team]
    ↓
Item received at warehouse
    ↓
Quality check (48-hour SLA)
    ↓
Refund processed → Customer notified
```

### 4.3 Return Reduction Strategies (Specific to Intus)

| Strategy | Expected Impact | Implementation |
|----------|----------------|---------------|
| **Fit predictor tool** | -12-18% size returns | See S01 CRO Playbook, Section 2.2 |
| **Customer photo reviews with size info** | -10-15% fit uncertainty | Post-purchase flow requests "What size did you order? How does it fit?" |
| **Detailed size guide with body measurements** | -5-10% size returns | Currently in Deliverable 10 trust gap section — upgrade to interactive tool |
| **Interactive fit guide** | Reduces unknown-fit anxiety | Add to PDP: height + weight + preferred fit inputs → personalised recommendation (see S01 CRO Playbook, Section 2.2) |
| **Lifestyle photos showing fit on diverse bodies** | Reduces "looked different online" returns | Shoot models across size range (XS-XL minimum) |

### 4.4 60-Day Guarantee Economics

Intus's 60-day guarantee is a category-defining trust signal and conversion tool (Deliverable 4 — Magician archetype). But it needs financial monitoring:

| Metric | Monitor Monthly | Warning Threshold |
|--------|----------------|-------------------|
| **Return rate** | % of orders returned | >20% triggers investigation |
| **Return timing** | When in the 60-day window do returns happen? | If >50% return in days 30-60, the policy may be encouraging "try and return" |
| **Return cost per order** | Total return costs / Total orders | >5% of revenue triggers review |
| **Net margin after returns** | Revenue - COGS - Shipping - Returns | Must remain positive |

**Important:** The 60-day guarantee may increase return rates by 5-10% vs. a 30-day policy. This is the cost of the conversion lift it provides. Monitor the trade-off: if the conversion lift (more orders) exceeds the cost of additional returns, keep it.

---

## 5. Inventory Management

### 5.1 Key Metrics

| Metric | Target | Definition |
|--------|--------|-----------|
| **Inventory turnover** | 4-6x per year (apparel DTC benchmark) | COGS / Average Inventory. Higher = healthier cash flow. |
| **Weeks of cover** | 8-12 weeks | How many weeks of sales the current inventory covers. Below 6 = stockout risk. Above 16 = cash tied up. |
| **Stockout rate** | <2% of SKUs | % of SKUs unavailable at any time. Every stockout = lost revenue + damaged brand trust. |
| **Sell-through rate** | >60% at full price | % of inventory sold at full price (not discounted). Intus doesn't discount = this should be 90%+. |

### 5.2 Demand Forecasting (Early-Stage)

Without historical data, use these signals:

| Signal | What It Tells You | How to Track |
|--------|-------------------|-------------|
| **"Notify me" signups** | Pre-validated demand for restocks | Shopify "Back in Stock" app — track by SKU |
| **Kit Quiz results** | Which Kit type is most popular | Klaviyo quiz completion data — segment by result |
| **Social engagement** | Which products generate buzz | Track saves/shares on product posts (higher save rate = higher purchase intent) |
| **Pre-order conversion** | Demand validation before committing to inventory | Run pre-orders for new colorways/Kits |
| **Weather data (AU)** | Seasonal demand shifts | Summer = shorts/tanks spike, winter = outerwear + recovery Kit |

### 5.3 Ordering Strategy

| Strategy | When | How |
|----------|------|-----|
| **Conservative initial order** | First production run of any new SKU | Order 60% of projected demand. Sell-through validates demand before reorder. |
| **Pre-order for new drops** | New colorway or Kit launch | "Coming [date] — Reserve yours" on PDP. Commit to production only after pre-order volume confirms demand. |
| **Reorder triggers** | Existing SKUs | Set reorder point at 8 weeks of cover remaining. Lead time from manufacturer = 4-6 weeks typically. |
| **Safety stock** | Best-selling SKUs only | Keep 2 extra weeks of cover for top 3 SKUs (likely Reformer Kit + Zyra Leggings). |

---

## 6. Packaging & Unboxing Experience

### 6.1 Why Packaging Matters for Intus

Unboxing is a primary TikTok content format in 2025. Camera-ready packaging drives UGC, which drives acquisition (see S03 Channel Benchmarks). For a Magician archetype, the unboxing IS the transformation moment.

### 6.2 Packaging Specification

| Element | Specification | Archetype Alignment |
|---------|--------------|-------------------|
| **Outer mailer** | Matte black compostable poly mailer (recycled material) | Magician: dark, mysterious, premium feel. Sustainability: baseline expectation (50%+ consumers value it). |
| **Inner tissue** | Branded tissue paper with subtle "Within" watermark | Sage: attention to detail, intentional presentation |
| **Insert card** | "Your Kit. Your Day." card with QR code → Care instructions + #MyIntusKit UGC invite | Drives UGC content creation + product care (reduces returns) |
| **Sticker** | Small branded sticker (laptop/water bottle size) | Community signaling. Low cost, high share rate. |
| **No plastic** | No poly bags around individual pieces. Roll and tissue-wrap instead. | Sustainability commitment. Gen Z expects this. |

### 6.3 Unboxing UGC Strategy

| Touchpoint | Action |
|-----------|--------|
| **Insert card CTA** | "Share your unboxing → Tag #MyIntusKit → Get featured" |
| **Post-purchase SMS** (from S02) | Day 1 after delivery: "Your Kit has arrived. Show us the moment → #MyIntusKit" |
| **Packaging design** | Camera-ready. Black exterior = contrast on camera. Clean interior = satisfying reveal. |
| **Incentive** | Featured on Intus Instagram/TikTok (social currency, not discount) |

---

## 7. Order Processing SLAs

| Metric | SLA | Rationale |
|--------|-----|-----------|
| **Same-day dispatch cutoff** | 2:00 PM AEST (self-fulfil) or per 3PL agreement | Enables 3-5 day domestic delivery. Consumer expectation: ~3.1 days click-to-door. |
| **Order confirmation email** | Immediate (automated) | Already in Deliverable 12, Flow 4 |
| **Shipping confirmation + tracking** | Within 2 hours of dispatch | Already in Deliverable 12, Flow 4 |
| **Delivery confirmation** | Real-time via carrier API | Triggers post-purchase SMS (S02) |
| **Return processing** | Within 48 hours of receipt | Fast refund = customer goodwill + faster restock |
| **Customer support response** | <4 hours during business hours, <24 hours after hours | Gorgias or Shopify Inbox. AI-assisted for common queries. |

---

## 8. Implementation Timeline

### Month 1: Foundation
- [ ] Set up self-service return portal (Loop Returns or Shopify native)
- [ ] Establish order processing SLAs (same-day dispatch before 2pm)
- [ ] Design and order branded packaging (compostable mailers, insert cards, stickers)
- [ ] Set up "Notify me" back-in-stock tracking per SKU
- [ ] Begin US shipping as DDP (Intus pays duties upfront)

### Month 2: Optimization
- [ ] Implement inventory tracking dashboard (weeks of cover, stockout alerts)
- [ ] Analyze return reason codes — identify top 3 return reasons
- [ ] Launch fit predictor tool (cross-reference with S01 CRO Playbook)
- [ ] Set reorder points for top-selling SKUs (8 weeks of cover)
- [ ] Research Australian 3PLs for Phase 2 (if approaching 100 orders/month)

### Month 3-6: Scale Preparation
- [ ] Onboard Australian 3PL (if volume warrants)
- [ ] Monitor US order volume monthly — plan US 3PL hub when hitting 150+/month trend
- [ ] Optimize packaging based on UGC feedback (what looks good on camera?)
- [ ] Implement pre-order system for new colorway/Kit launches
- [ ] Set up automated demand forecasting using Kit Quiz data + social signals

### Month 6-12: International Expansion
- [ ] Evaluate US 3PL hub economics (bulk import vs. direct ship cost comparison)
- [ ] If US hub activated: transfer top-selling SKUs, set up Shopify multi-location
- [ ] Review and renegotiate 3PL contract terms based on volume growth
- [ ] Explore additional international markets (NZ, UK) if US is profitable

---

## 9. Key Financial Metrics to Track Monthly

| Metric | Formula | Target |
|--------|---------|--------|
| **Logistics cost ratio** | (Fulfilment + Shipping) / Revenue | <20-25% |
| **Return cost ratio** | Total Return Costs / Revenue | <5% |
| **Cost per order** | Total Operations Cost / Total Orders | Track trend (should decrease as volume scales) |
| **US order profitability** | US Revenue - COGS - Shipping - Duties | Must be positive (even if lower margin than AU) |
| **Inventory turnover** | COGS / Average Inventory | 4-6x per year |
| **Customer satisfaction (delivery)** | Post-delivery NPS or CSAT | >4.5/5 stars |
